<rule id="security-02800" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <file filename="{*}opensaml{*}.jar"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded library - OpenSAML">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds an OpenSAML library. The Microsoft identity platform uses SAML and other protocols to enable applications to provide a Single Sign-On experience.

                        By migrating your SSO implementation to Azure AD with SAML, you leverage the capabilities of Azure AD for managing identities and enabling secure SSO across your applications. Azure AD offers features like multi-factor authentication, conditional access policies, and seamless integration with various SaaS applications, providing a robust and scalable solution for identity and access management in the cloud.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/auth-saml" title="SAML authentication with Azure Active Directory"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/saml-protocol-reference" title="How the Microsoft identity platform uses the SAML protocol"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop" title="Microsoft identity platform documentation"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory" title="Azure Active Directory documentation"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">OpenSAML</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
